column4: hey, I am trying to install Ubuntu, but X wont start for some reason.  I don't really care, I just need to know how to start the Ubuntu installer from the command line
if you've run the install and gdm is failing, hit ctl+alt+F1 to get to a console
if X is your only problem, try dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
ok, let me try that
do you know what video card you have?
you can run lspci and find out if it is ATI, Nvidia, etc
it's some intigrated Intel card
ok, that should be supported out of the box, fool around with dpkg-reconfigure and when you're done, do a sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart and see if it gets better, repeat as needed
I still haven't gotten dpkg -reconfigure to work... it just says dpkg: conflicting actions --control and --remove [...]
what errors are you getting in /var/log/Xorg.0.log?
how do I check?
less /var/log/Xorg.0.log
have you installed ubuntu? what installer are you trying to run?
Breezy is installed on this computer, as well as WinXP, but I am trying to run the Dapper installer becuase I want to repartition and overwrite all of that
if you want to upgrade, edit /etc/apt/sources.list and change all instances of breezy to dapper and then aptitude update && aptitude dist-upgrade
I don't want to upgrade though, I want to start with a completely fresh install
ok, so do you have an installer downloaded?
or are you trying from CD?
skippy: yes, I am trying from the CD right now, I just want to run the installer
there is no X-based install, it's text-mode
is the install failing at any point, or are you looking for a gui?
I went to the option "start or install" or whatever it is called, and it came up with the "can't start X" error
